  • DDR4: Common today, ~2133â€“3200+ MHz

ğŸ§  Tip: ECC is slower and pricier, and usually wonâ€™t work in regular consumer motherboards.

ğŸ”€ RAM Channel Configurations

Single-Channel

One stick of RAM â€” functional but slower.

Dual-Channel

Two sticks installed in matching paired slots (color-coded). Doubles data path and improves performance.

ğŸ§  Tip: Always check the motherboard manual for correct slot configuration.

Triple-Channel

Seen on some older Intel platforms. Needs 3 matching sticks in the right configuration.

Quad-Channel

Used in high-end desktops and workstations. Offers peak bandwidth with 4 identical modules.

ğŸ§  Tip: Channel setup affects performance more than just raw RAM speed.
